contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=March 2013}} '''Ian R. Kahn''' (born April 21, 1972)<ref>''U.S. Public Records Index'' Vol 1 & 2 (Provo, UT: Ancestry.com Operations, Inc.), 2010.</ref> is an [[United States|American]] stage and television actor, perhaps best known for his roles on ''[[Bull (TV series)|Bull]]'' and ''[[The Unusuals]]''. He made his Broadway debut in ''ENRON'' at the Broadhurst Theater in April 2010. In September 2009, he made his off-Broadway debut in MCC's ''Still Life''. He has appeared in major regional theater companies across the United States. Some of his roles have included Mortimer in ''[[Arsenic and Old Lace]]'' at Baltimore Center Stage, Algernon in ''[[The Importance of Being Earnest]]'' at the Arena Stage, Jamie in ''[[Long Day's Journey Into Night]]'' at The Alley Theater, Johnny Wheelwright in ''[[A Prayer For Owen Meany]]'' at Roundhouse theater, Tom in ''[[The Glass Menagerie]]'' at St. Louis Rep, Henry Higgins in ''[[My Fair Lady]]'' at The Media Theater, Septimus Hodge in ''Arcadia'' at the Wilma Theater, and as [[William Shakespeare]] in ''The Beard of Avon'' at the Cape Playhouse. He is currently a frequent guest and adviser on the Dan Lebatard radio show. He graduated from the Ethical Culture Fieldston School in Riverdale, Bronx, New York in 1990 and from [[Skidmore College]] ([[Saratoga Springs, New York]]) in 1994. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" ! Year ! Title ! Episode Name !
